data.title: Been coming here from day one!
data.text: I started coming here because of the manager "Johnny" what ever happened to him? Anyway he always made me feel welcomed but lets face it, you can go anywhere for a drink right? But the place was new the food was off the hook and Johnny made it like I had to come back! There really aren't many places around here with this quality price along with consistency. So try it, you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Excellent food and drinks
data.text: The Social has very fresh and tasty food.  The fish is superb, as well as any of the special dishes on the menu.  The Social Salad is so fresh tasting and the dressing is delicious and lite.  I love this place!

data.title: Sunday Dinner
data.text: My wife and I eat here every month or two. We have been going to this restaurant since it opened a number of years ago. They are wine friendly and have a great martini menu. We took some good friends there for dinner this past Sunday. Unfortunately they were below the standards that we have come to expect of them. The usual fine service we have experienced in the past was very slow. Perhaps they were understaffed that night. We ordered the crab cake appetizer and it was over cooked. They said that's the way it always comes but we have had it many times before and knew better. They made new ones which were the delicious morsels we were used to. We also split the Mac & Cheese for an appetizer and it was delicious as always. I had a blackened salmon that was a large portion and tasty but too under cooked in the center for my taste. Two of the group had the Osso Buco and it was delicious as usual ( my wife's favorite) and comes with mushroom risotto. We also had the rack of lamb which was very good. For desert we had the lemon cake which was moist and flavorful. We also had another desert that was white cake with fruit that was very good. I would have scored this place higher but they slipped a little on our last visit. We will definitely be going back.

data.title: a pleasant surprise
data.text: lLcated in a strip mall next to Vallarta supermarket is a nice jewel of a restaurant.  Food is good and they certainly know how to make a great cosmo.

data.title: Great Little Hideaway, The Social!!
data.text:
The Social has a great little bar. They have a great Happy Hour, Tuesday - Saturday.
The drinks and food are excellent!!

data.title: Yummy food, super service!
data.text: This is a wonderful locally owned restaurant that serves fabulous dishes.  They also have a lovely Gluten-Free menu.  I wanted to try a few things so I went during their Happy Hour.  I had their Filet Mignon satay/skewers and their coconut chicken satay (skewers) and a Caesar salad.  Everything was yummy! The price was right too!  The owner is usually there and is very friendly and attentive.  I'll be going again.

data.title: It's the Social
data.text: Love the place. Enjoyable ambience, delicious cocktails, laughing, chatting, yummy dining, at the bar or at tables. Happy employees, Gabriel. Charming owner, Patrick. It's where I go when I'm in that part of the world, and everyone is excited to meet there; it's The Social.

data.title: Very very good... don't let the location scare you away
data.text: What does one say of a 5 star in a strip mall?  All I can say is fantastic.  The food is to die for, the drinks, well fantastic!  Once you enter the doors you would never remember what was outside.  Complex food done very well.  Love this place.

data.title: More than just a social gathering
data.text: First time visit. Great martinis, friendly staff, and delicious food! Julie listened to what I wanted to eat, and asked if she could create a dish just for me.  Tom's Mac 'n' Cheese Fettucine Alfredo with bacon. What's not to like?

data.title: The social
data.text: Happy hour is the best. They serve food that is cooked to order & is so good. Very reasonable in price at that time. Do I dare say cheap for what you get.  I eat early so this is perfect for me. Drinks are good too.

data.title: A great place for Dinner.
data.text: Patrick the owner always greats us sometime during our meal.  The meals are always great and the service is just as good.  The food is fairly priced and there corkage fee is reasonable.  I recommend this all the time to my friends.

data.title: A popular local restaurant due to its incredible selection of martinis
data.text: We came here with a friend recently after not having been here for years.  The menu seemed limited and I had a hard time selecting what I wanted.  I finally decided on the Cuban skirt steak which was fine but not as good as at the local Cuban restaurant.  Our friend ordered a martini and was pleased with it.  Fortunately, we were seated in the corner so could hear better than in other locations as the bar is very close and very crowded.  The service was very good, however.

data.title: Strong go to for pamering
data.text: This is a great find - food is excellent, service really personal. Martinis are extraordinary and they have a huge selection. Menu small but we haven't had anything we didn't like. Lobster ravioli is notably good.

data.title: A Favorite before the theater
data.text: This is our go to place for special dinners and before heading out to the theater at the Rep East. Martinis are the bar specialty. Food, service, atmosphere is excellent. Patrick is always willing to go the extra mile to make certain his patrons are comfortable and have a wonderful dining experience.

data.title: Just OK
data.text:
I really wanted to like this restaurant.  After reading the reviews definitely had positive expectations.  Our party was two couples.  My husband had a martini, the escargot and the jambalaya.  I had a martini, the crab cakes and the chicken piccata.  Our friends both had the filet mignon and one had a martini.  

My husband's escargot was slightly overcooked and while it had a flavorful sauce it was rather unattractivey presented with thick sauce over the shells of  escargot. He said the jambalaya was good but could have used a little salt.  My crabcake patty had nice flavor but no discernible lumps of crabmeat and were a little thin and small.  The accompanying salad was nice and this dish was nicely presented.  My chicken in the piccata consisted of 3 too thick and slightly overcooked pieces of chicken and the sauce was just tart with capers.  I frequently have this dish in other establishments as it is a favorite of mine.  Usually the chicken is gently cooked medallions(pounded thinner) and the sauce is tart but has other dimensions like garlic, butter and stock.  The angel hair pasta was just a portion of pasta sans sauce or oil or topping of any kind that I could detect.  The broccoli was good but a kind of tiny portion. Our friends said the filet was nicely cooked.  

None of the dishes except the crabcakes seemed nicely presented.  So, 3 martinis , 2 appetizers, 3 entrees, no wine, no coffee and no desserts our bill was $145 without gratuity. Not bad but we don't mind paying a little more when the food is a bit better. While we were initially kind of reluctant to go to what was reputed to be a nicer restaurant in the area it is located, the inside is attractive and has nice ambiance.  The staff is very attentive.  Will likely not go back.

data.title: Must try in Santa Clarita
data.text: Went for a dinner based on good reviews and was not disappointed.  Great menu with a lot of variety.  Numerous Martini and mixed drinks at the bar.  Atmosphere was good and service was very good.  Do not let the location of the restaurant fool you, you must try this place for a special occasion.  We had lobster and steak and were very satisfied.  We spent about $120. for dinner for two and one drink each.

data.title: The Social is not a bad choice for dinner in Newhall.
data.text: The Social is a neighborhood standby, possibly more well-known for its selection of martinis than food, but the food ain't bad, and it's reasonably well-priced.

data.title: Just Average
data.text: Tried out this place, last night. It is located in a strip mall in Newhall. We didn't let this put us off, after all, there isn't much scenery in Newhall, it's all basically one parking lot or another for views. our waitress was prompt and professional. Our drinks were served right away, as well was out food. We started out with the Grilled Artichoke...which was good...however the mayo dip was really bland and we didn't use it. The bread was served with an interesting tampenade, but served in a way that made you wonder what it was. We ordered the Filet. As tender as it was, there just wasn't very much flavor to it, again bland. The potatoes were over done and dry. Where as the service was very good, I just couldn't give it more than an average. If it hadn't been for the service, it may not have even made that...The place is a little pricey for the atmosphere and the food we were served.

data.title: Xmas eve dinner
data.text: Very disappointed in our Xmas eve dinner at the social. Read reviews on trip advisor and was excited to eat there when traveling from IL to visit family in calif.   Called a week ahead for a vegan meal. No record of such when we arrived.  They "threw together" (their term) a pasta with red sauce that was average. Waitress was not friendly. We understood that it was a holiday but it seemed the restaurant didn't anticipate the large parties and the service was SLOW. Halibut was great. Lobster ravioli good.

data.title: Great Ambiance; Great Food!
data.text: We just had our first meal with friends at The Social.  I checked the reviews on "tripadvisor" prior to booking the reservation.  The reviews turned out to be accurate.  The host was very helpful when we got lost on the way there ( we had an 80 mile drive) and was understanding when we were about 10 minutes late for our reservation.  The waitress was very nice, very pleasant and knowledgeable. The food was worth the drive.  We will go again!   Very convenient for us to meet friends halfway to the coast - they enjoyed it too!
